Configuring Port Range Forwarding

To add a port range forwarding rule:

 1. Choose Firewall > Port Range Forwarding.

 2. In the Application field, enter the name of the application for which to configure port forwarding.

 3. In the External Port field, specify the port number that will trigger this rule when a connection request from outgoing traffic is made.

 4. In the Start field, specify the port number that begins the range of ports to forward.

 5. In the End field, specify the port number that ends the range of ports to forward.

 6. In the Interface drop-down menu, choose Both (Ethernet & 3G), Ethernet, or 3G.

 7. From the Protocol drop-down menu, choose a protocol (TCP, UDP, or TCP & UDP).

 8. In the IP Address field, enter the IP address of the host on the LAN side to which the specific IP traffic will be forwarded.

 9. In the Enable field, check the Enable box to enable the rule.

 10. Click Save.
